main_pages.title: SERVICES
main_pages.description:
The Salvation Army of Summit County provides two food panties.  
 
First, their Red Shield Food Pantry is a collaborative program with the Akron-Canton Food Bank that directly distributes food to anyone.  
 
Second, their Choice Pantry provides families/individuals with a cart of food including meat, dairy, fresh vegetables, and shelf stable food as available for individuals who have received an official emergency referral through the 211 OR 330-376-4850 InfoLine.

main_pages.title: CONTACT
main_pages.description:
Intake InfoLine: 211   |||   330-376-4850 
 
Red Shield Food Pantry Phone: 330-762-8481 
 
Website: https://easternusa.salvationarmy.org/northeast-ohio/summit-county/cure-hunger/  
 
Address: 1033 Bellows St., Akron, OH 44311 
 
Intake InfoLine Hours: 24/7 
 
Red Shield Food Pantry Hours: Second Weds of every month but December, 9:00A-11:00A 
 
Emergency Food Pantry Hours: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri through referral and by appointment (you MUST go through the InfoLine above)

main_pages.title: SERVICES
main_pages.description:
The Open M Neighborhood Center has multiple food pantries and a grab-and-go lunch. 
  
First, the Emergency Food Pantry provides participants with a three-day supply of shelf-stable products and fresh foods. Participants are eligible for food every 31 days and must reside in the 44301, 44311, 44224, 44321, 44307, 44320, 44308, or 44203 zip codes. Another person may pick up food for someone else, but you must have a current proxy on file.  
 
Second, the Mountain of Food is a one-day, bulk distribution of foods such as produce, meat, breads and more. Participants must bring an ID with an address. No referral or pre-registration is required for this program. If picking up for someone else, you must have a current proxy on file. 
 
Third, the Senior Supplemental Food Program helps improve the health of elderly citizens through supplemental and nutritious food boxes. Participants must meet income guidelines and be pre-registered for the Commodity Supplemental Food Program (learn more at https://jfs.ohio.gov/cash-food-and-refugee-assistance/food-assistance/food-programs/commodity-supplemental-food-program). 
 
Fourth, the Blessing Box is an outdoor pantry box stocked with non-perishable sacked meals for those in need of emergency assistance after-hours when the Emergency Food Pantry is closed. 
 
In addition to those food pantries, Open M’s Grab & Go Lunch provides fresh, healthy meals to the community during the last two weeks of each month. It is provided in partnership with churches, organizations, and community groups who purchase, prepare, and serve each meal. 
 
Open M also offers services in the Work, Financial, & Legal Support and  Medical Care categories.

main_pages.title: CONTACT
main_pages.description:
Phone: 330-434-0110, ext. 416 
 
Email: food@openm.org 
 
Website: https://www.openm.org/   |||   https://www.openm.org/food  
 
Address: 941 Princeton St., Akron, OH 443311 
 
Contact Hours: Mon-Fri 8:00A-4:30P 
 
Emergency Food Pantry Hours: Mon-Thurs 11:30A-2:00P   |||   Fri 9:00A-11:00A 
 
Mountain of Food Hours: Third Fri of every month, 9:00A-11:00A 
 
Senior Supplemental Food Program: Multiple days within the second week of each month 
 
Blessing Box: Evenings (after 4:30P) every day of the week, as available 
 
Grab & Go Lunch Hours: Last 2 weeks of each month, Mon-Fri 11:30A-1:00P

main_pages.title: SERVICES
main_pages.description:
The Peter Maurin Center of Akron offers both a food pantry and an open community lunch. 
 
First, the Peter Maurin Center’s food pantry offers canned food, boxed food, fresh meat, milk, fruits, and vegetables when available. If you cannot make it in-person, the Peter Maurin Center’s Matthew 8:20 Outreach Program may be able to travel out into the field and deliver meals and supplies to your home. If you need this service, contact the Peter Maurin Center directly. 
 
Second, the Peter Maurin Center offers an open community lunch every Tuesday, Friday, and Sunday from 11:00A-2:00P at their Community Center. 
 
The Peter Maurin Center also offers services in the Shelter, Housing, & Utilities; Medical Care; and Transportation categories.

main_pages.title: CONTACT
main_pages.description:
Phone: 330-258-9006  
 
Online Message: https://www.petermaurincenter.com/contact   
 
Website: https://www.petermaurincenter.com/   
 
Address: 1096 Old S. Main St., Akron, OH 44301  
 
Contact Hours: 24/7 
 
Drop-In center (with Lunch): Tues, Fri, and Sun 11:00A-2:00P 
 
Food Pantry Hours: Second and fourth Sat of every month, 10:00A-12:00P

main_pages.title: SERVICES
main_pages.description:
Church of Our Savior Episcopal offers both a food pantry and two monthly community dinners.  
 
First, The Friendly Pantry is an outreach ministry that distributes non-perishable groceries for free to those in need. Learn more at https://episcopalakron.org/community/. 
 
Second, Dinner On Us offers a hot meal to be shared with neighbors on the last two Wednesdays of each month. No reservations are needed and children are welcome.

main_pages.title: CONTACT
main_pages.description:
Phone: 330-535-9174 
 
Website: https://episcopalakron.org/  
 
Address: 471 Crosby St., Akron, OH 44302 
 
Dinner on Us Hours: Last two Weds of each month; doors open at 5:45P and dinner begins at 6:15P 
 
The Friendly Pantry Hours: Last Mon of each month, 8:00A; ask during a Dinner on Us or ask a priest/usher on a Sun morning

main_pages.title: SERVICES
main_pages.description: The Good Shepherd’s Baptist Church’s Shepherd’s Table provides a food pantry for those in need. You must bring a photo ID to receive food.

main_pages.title: CONTACT
main_pages.description:

Address: 1010 S. Hawkins Ave., Akron, OH 44320 
 
Food Pantry Hours: Second and fourth Tues of every month, 12:00P-2:00P

main_pages.title: SERVICES
main_pages.description:
The Community AIDS Network & Pride Institute (CANAPI) provides a food pantry for individuals who have HIV, receive less than 80% of the median income in the past two months, and live in either Summit or Portage Country. You MUST bring a photo ID to receive food. 
 
For your first visit, bring a verification of your HIV+ status, verification of income (e.g., benefit letter, two months of most recent pay stubs for all in your household), and a photo ID. Alternatively, have a participating agency (Equitas Health or the C.A.R.E. Center) fax or email your CANAPI Nutritional Program Referral form with attached verification of HIV+ status and income verification and bring a photo ID. 
 
CANAPI also offers services in the Shelter, Housing, & Utilities and Medical Care categories.

main_pages.title: CONTACT
main_pages.description:

Email: info@canapi.org 
 
Website: https://www.canapi.org/   |||   https://www.canapi.org/food-pantry  
 
Address: 759 W. Market St., 1st Floor, Akron, OH 44303 
 
Business Hours: Mon-Fri 9:00A-5:00P 
 
Food Pantry Hours: 10:00A-12:30P on select bimonthly Thurs; see https://www.canapi.org/food-pantry for dates

main_pages.title: SERVICES
main_pages.description:
Street Outreach Services (SOS) offers street-based and drop-in services to individuals ages 16-24 experiencing homelessness in Summit County. Their SOS drop-in center provides access to grocery items, clothing, personal care and hygiene items, and household items, bus passes, in addition to a variety of other services. Their drop-in center can provide hot meals as a part of their comprehensive support services. 
 
SOS also provides services in the Mental Health, Addiction, & Family Services; Shelter, Housing, & Utilities; Work, Financial, & Legal Support; and Transportation categories.

main_pages.title: SERVICES
main_pages.description:
St. Bernard Parish provides a food pantry and two individual meal programs. 
 
The St. Bernard Parish Food Pantry supplies over 300 households each month a three-day supply of non-perishable groceries and available household supplies. 
 
St. Bernard Parish offers two individual meal programs. First, their Hot Meals Program serves more than 1,000 meals each month in the Social Hall of Sr. Bernard’s church. Second, their Bag Lunch Program provides over 2,000 sack lunches and coffee per month to those going to work or those out-of-work.

main_pages.title: CONTACT
main_pages.description:
Phone: 330-253-5161 
 
Website: https://stbernardakron.org/hunger-programs  
 
Address: 44 University Ave., Akorn, OH 44308 
 
Food Pantry Hours: Thurs 9:00A-10:30A 
 
Hot Meal Hours: Second, fourth, and fifth Weds and Sun of each month at 5:00P in the Social Hall of the Sr. Bernard church 
 
Bag Lunch Hours: Mon-Fri 8:00A-9:00A in the Corbett Center (AKA the Bologna House) adjacent to the church

main_pages.title: SERVICES
main_pages.description: Sarah’s House offers a food pantry on the first Sunday and third Saturday of each month. To receive services, you must bring a mask, a photo ID, and bags/boxes. Other essential household items are also available. Quantities of food may be limited. On the third Sat of each month, a hot meal is available to-go during the food pantry.

Food Pantry Hours: First Sun of each month, 3:00P   |||   Third Sat of each month, 8:00A 
 
To-Go Hot Meal Hours: Third Sat of each month, 8:00A
